title: Everyday English Course 47
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: They said that the eleven o'clock train was running late again, like before.
W: We arrived at the station at exactly 10:00. However, we've already been waiting for thirty minutes. What time did they say it would arrive?
M: Well, we'll probably have to wait another quarter of an hour.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: They said that the eleven o'clock train was running late again, like before.
W: We arrived at the station at exactly 10:00. However, we've already been waiting for thirty minutes. What time did they say it would arrive?
M: Well, we'll probably have to wait another quarter of an hour.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
M: They said that the eleven o'clock train was running late again, like before.
W: We arrived at the station at exactly 10:00. However, we've already been waiting for thirty minutes. What time did they say it would arrive?
M: Well, we'll probably have to wait another quarter of an hour.
{a}

variables.a: What time is it now?
Where are the speakers now?
What is the man doing right now?

answerOptions: Jack wants to have an early supper.
Jack wants to take the children to see a film.

variables.a: Why does Jack want to leave right away?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Nike, why don't you come and join us this afternoon? It'll be a lot of fun.
M: I'd love to, but I've got an exam.
W: What about tomorrow afternoon?
M: Saturday is OK.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: Nike, why don't you come and join us this afternoon? It'll be a lot of fun.
M: I'd love to, but I've got an exam.
W: What about tomorrow afternoon?
M: Saturday is OK.
{a}

{a}

variables.a: When does the conversation take place?

answerOptions: They should go to the lake.
They should go to the park.
They should go to the zoo.
instances.correctAnswer: They should go to the zoo.

variables.a: Where does the woman think they should go this Sunday?

answerOptions: She didn't like the books the man bought.
There wasn't a large selection at the bookstore.
The man bought a lot of books.
instances.correctAnswer: The man bought a lot of books.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Can I help you?
M: Yes, I bought these shoes here two days ago. But they seem too small and press against my feet.
W: Let me see, um, what do you think I should do?
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:

M: Yes, I bought these shoes here two days ago. But they seem too small and press against my feet.
W: Let me see, um, what do you think I should do?
{a}

M: Yes, I bought these shoes here two days ago. But they seem too small and press against my feet.
W: Let me see, um, what do you think I should do?

variables.a: Where is the dialogue happening?
Where does it possibly happen?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: That'll be four pounds fifty for this parcel. Oh dear!
W: What's the matter?
M: You've put sticky tape all over it. I'm afraid you'll have to take it away and repack it.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: That'll be four pounds fifty for this parcel. Oh dear!
W: What's the matter?
M: You've put sticky tape all over it. I'm afraid you'll have to take it away and repack it.
{a}

variables.a: Where are the speakers?

sections.title: Section 2: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: What relationship between the two persons could be?

answerOptions: Go for a drink with her friends.
Meet her friends at a repair shop..
instances.correctAnswer: Go for a drink with her friends.

variables.a: What will Lisa do after work?

answerOptions: The two speakers are at a loss what to do.
The man is worried about his future.
The two speakers are seniors at college.
instances.correctAnswer: The two speakers are seniors at college.

variables.a: What do we learn from the conversation?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: You look tired. Did you sleep well?
M: No. My friend and I had a party the whole night.
W: You should go home and take a rest.
M: I know, but my boss wants to see me right now.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: You look tired. Did you sleep well?
M: No. My friend and I had a party the whole night.
W: You should go home and take a rest.
M: I know, but my boss wants to see me right now.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
W: You look tired. Did you sleep well?
M: No. My friend and I had a party the whole night.
W: You should go home and take a rest.
M: I know, but my boss wants to see me right now.
{a}

variables.a: What will the man probably do?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: What do you think of my paper, Pr6fessor North?
W: Hm...The ideas are good. If I were you though, I'd rewrite it in some places to make it clearer. See the places I marked.
M: All right. Thanks for your advice.
{a}

{a}

variables.a: What is the man probably going to do?
When does the man want a room in the hotel?
Where are they talking probably?

answerOptions: She has been to the dentist's and is in much pain.
She has one of her teeth filled at the dentist's.
She doesn't feel like eating because she isn't hungry.
instances.correctAnswer: She has been to the dentist's and is in much pain.

variables.a: Why isn't Rebecca going to eat?

answerOptions: He has trouble opening his lips.

variables.a: Why doesn't the man eat his cake?

answerOptions: The exam questions were too difficult.
The questions had little connection with the course.
He couldn't finish the questions within the time allowed.
instances.correctAnswer: The questions had little connection with the course.

variables.a: What was the man's opinion of the exam?

sections.title: Section 3: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

answerOptions: In front of a clothes shop.
instances.correctAnswer: In front of a clothes shop.

variables.a: Where are they standing now?

answerOptions: He has left his position in the government.
He has already reached the retirement age.
He made a stupid decision at the cabinet meeting.
instances.correctAnswer: He has left his position in the government.

variables.a: What do we learn about Jame Smeil?
What will Lucy do at 11:30 tomorrow?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Does Jenny plan to go to summer school?
W: No, she wants to work and save some money in the summer.
M: That's good. Maybe she can help and pay some of the university fees next term.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: Does Jenny plan to go to summer school?
W: No, she wants to work and save some money in the summer.
M: That's good. Maybe she can help and pay some of the university fees next term.
{a}

W: No, she wants to work and save some money in the summer.

variables.a: What is Jenny?

answerOptions: He wants to go to the concert, too.
He wants to stay at home and do his homework.
instances.correctAnswer: He wants to go to the concert, too.

variables.a: What does the man mean?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Did you see the film on Channel 6 yesterday?
W: No. I saw an interesting TV play on Channel 1. How about the film?
M: Not bad. It was about a girl who wants to realize her dream of becoming a dancer.
W: Really? I wanted to see the film for long.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: Did you see the film on Channel 6 yesterday?
W: No. I saw an interesting TV play on Channel 1. How about the film?
M: Not bad. It was about a girl who wants to realize her dream of becoming a dancer.
W: Really? I wanted to see the film for long.
{a}

{a}
